article.title: DeepXplore: Automated Whitebox Testing of Deep Learning Systems

multiple_choice_question.text: What erroneous behavior does this figure illustrate DeepXplore finding?
choices: A DNN-based self-driving car correctly turns left for a bright image, but incorrectly turns right for a darker version of the same image.
A DNN-based self-driving car misclassifies a guardrail as a road.
A DNN-based self-driving car fails to recognize a pedestrian in low-light conditions.
A DNN-based self-driving car consistently veers to the right, regardless of input.

multiple_choice_question.text: What key difference does this figure highlight between traditional software development and ML system development?
choices: Traditional software development involves direct specification of logic by the developer, while ML system development involves learning from data.
Traditional software development relies solely on manual testing, while ML system development relies solely on automated testing.
Traditional software development doesn\'t require user input, while ML system development heavily depends on user input.
Traditional software development focuses on security, while ML system development focuses on efficiency.

multiple_choice_question.text: What analogy does this figure use to explain the problem of low test coverage in DNNs?
choices: Executing malware in a sandbox to check its maliciousness.
Training a DNN using a small dataset.
Finding bugs in traditional software by using test inputs with low code coverage.
Adding humanly imperceptible perturbations to existing images to fool DNNs.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the core functionality of DeepXplore as illustrated in this figure?
choices: Manually labeling large datasets for training DNNs.
Generating test inputs that maximize neuron coverage and behavioral differences between DNNs.
Training multiple DNNs with different architectures and parameters.
Visualizing the activation of different layers in a DNN.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 6b illustrate in the context of DeepXplore?
choices: Two identical DNNs producing the same output for a given input.
DeepXplore\'s failure to find any difference-inducing inputs.
The process of training two similar DNNs with different datasets and parameters.
DeepXplore successfully finding a test input that causes two similar DNNs to produce different outputs.
